info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 30 at 4:20PM EDT until March 30 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in south central Georgia, Worth. In southwest Georgia, Dougherty and Lee.
* WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 420 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albany, Turner City, East Albany, Marine Corps Logistics Base, Radium Springs, Pecan City, South Albany and Southwest Ga Regional A/P. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Dougherty, GA; Lee, GA; Worth, GA
